intro: Trichomanes sericeum, commonly known as silky water fern, is a delicate fern species belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, silky-textured fronds that give it a distinctive appearance. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its small, inconspicuous spore-producing structures are located on the underside of its leaves. Trichomanes sericeum is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
